While the lucrative twenty-twenty deal ($20 million upfront and 20% of gross profit) doled out to the likes of Harrison Ford and Tom Cruise may be more or less gone...

dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Leonardo DiCaprio's career declined? I think someone's got their facts a bit... skewed there. *The Revenant* would like a word.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, it gets weirder. It's titled "The World's Lowest-Paid Actors," but then it says Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is *last* on the Forbes list, collecting $89.4 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, it gets weirder. It's titled The World's Lowest-Paid Actors, but then it says Dwayne The Rock Johnson is last on the Forbes list, collecting eighty nine point four million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dwayne Johnson, also known as the Rock, tops the Forbes list of the worlds ten highest-paid actors, collecting $89.4 million between June 1, 2018, and June 1, 2019.

dialogue_turns.text: Eighty-nine million dollars is "lowest-paid"? Uh, sign me up for that kind of low pay, please.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eighty-nine million dollars is lowest-paid? Uh, sign me up for that kind of low pay, please.

dialogue_turns.text: I know! But then it explains he lost a bunch on high-profile bets, and his new *Jumanji* deal? It's like, only $23.5 million upfront, and he has to pay 15% of the gross.

dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so his financial situation is actually kinda messy despite the huge numbers. [overlaps] He said, like, "audience first," but apparently, they weren't happy.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has to be audience first. What does the audience want, and what is the best scenario that we can create that will send them home happy? Johnson told Forbes in 2018. It seems he makes the audience happy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then it mentions Robert Downey Jr. His "Iron Man" deal, which we all thought was massive, apparently only netted him about $55 million because the film "failed."

dialogue_turns.text: A film failing but still getting RDJ $55 million... that's a different kind of failure, I guess.

dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But then it throws in this claim that George Clooney was found guilty of tax evasion, and Chris Hemsworth, Bradley Cooper, and Paul Rudd also had massive tax evasion issues, losing $284 million.

dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's just so confidently stated! But then it goes to Bradley Cooper, saying *A Star Is Born* essentially bankrupted him. Lost $435 million worldwide, leaving him $40 million in debt.
